title: For Sale:  1800's LeFaucheux  Shotgun?
postcontent: When I purchased this gun, I was told that it is a LeFaucheux made in the late 1800's. Probably from Paris, France or Belgium area from what he told me. I have not been able to confirm this myself, but the person I purchased it from is very knowledgable about these guns, so I took his word for it. I do not guarantee it because I can find no name on it. All I can find are the stampings on the underside of the barrel when it is removed from the main action. It has a stamping that you can see in the pictures. It looks like a Lf with a crown or something over it. It has a number stamped in it also. Also the butt plate has the same number stamped on it with a bird like an eagle with initials in it.The gun is very well made, and is a 16 guage that has had an optional German made Rekord 22 cal. barrel inserted in the left barrel. It can be removed with just a twist of the retainer screw, and tapped out from the other end of the barrel. It only goes about halfway through the shotgun barrel.Also I have a set of Browning Little Skeeters mini-tube guage reducers to shoot 20 guage low powered shotgun shells. I was told not to shoot high powered shells in it.The barrels are NOT Demascus. They are what was known as "Stub Twist" steel made from horse shoe nails. It is a 30,3/4" long barrel, and the gun is around 47" long overall, and is very tight. The hammers are not actually hammers. They are "Cockers", and have very strong springs. The triggers are very tight, and the whole gun was a very impressive piece of work. It has a front barrel release that is made from what looks like cow horn. It has one very small crack probably from shrinkage over the years, but it still looks good, and works great.There is some minor pitting in a couple areas around where the shells feed into the barrel, and on the forestock removal lever. Not bad for it's age.The gun is engraved all over, and looks really nice in real life. The pictures do it no justice.I have attempted to take good pictures to show it, and can only post 5, but I could send more on request if needed.
